CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 16 In the McCulloch group , in addition , a hole mobility of 0.24 cm^2 V -1 S^-1 and a PCE of 2.2% were reported in a polymer containing benzo[1,2-b:3,4-b′:5,6-d′]trithiophene ( BTT ) to produce effective intermolecular packing characteristics. 17,18 Quinacridone ( QC ) derivative , which is known as a red - violet pigment , has a high crystallinity and self - assembled characteristics , so it has drawn significant attention as an OTFT because of its high mobility. 19,20 However , these QC results were primarily reported for small molecules or oligomers. In the case of polymers , extremely limited results have been reported. 21,22 In the Takimiya group , recently , a polymer composed of QC derivatives has been reported for use in OTFTs that has a high hole mobility ( 0.2 cm^2 V -1 S^-1 ). 23 In this study , we synthesized a new donor - acceptor type ( D- A type ) polymer , poly[quinacridone-alt-octyloxydithienylbenzothiadiazole] ( PQCDTB ) , which contained QC and octyloxydithienylbenzothiadiazole ( DTB ). As a result , it is most likely that a broad absorbance could be obtained as the results of the effective charge transport and the strong electron - withdrawing caused by the high coplanarity . Table 1 shows the result of the molecular weight and the thermal properties of the obtained PQCDTB. As shown in this table , when the GPC was measured using polystyrene as the standard , the number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB were 49.8 and 15.2 kg / mol , respectively. In contrast , the polydispersity indices ( PDIs ) showed a very narrow distribution of 1.92 and 1.77 , respectively. In terms of the degree of polymerization , PQCDTB was greater than other OPV polymers by 2-3 times because of the introduction of long , branched side chains of quinacridone and benzothiadiazole. As a result , the backbone structure became relatively favorable in terms of the solubility at polymerization ; polymerization had effectively occurred. 6 Table 1 showed the result of the thermal analysis through TGA. As shown in Table 1 , PQCDTB and PCZDTB had a 5% weight loss at the temperatures of 323 and 324 °C , respectively , displaying a high thermal stability because of the rigid QC and carbazole structure , which is applicable for optoelectronic devices and OPVs , both of which require a high thermal stability ( 300 °C or above ). 24 We investigated thermal behavior through DSC analysis ( see Supporting Information ) , which revealed no obvious thermal transitions for PQCDTB in the temperature range from 40 to 250 ° C. Thus , PQCDTB displayed amorphous property. Figure 1 showed X-ray diffraction measurements of film to analyze the ordering structure of the obtained polymers.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Benzo[1,2-b:3,4-b′:5,6-d′]trithiophene (BTT) |
| Quinacridone (QC) |
| Poly[quinacridone-alt-octyloxydithienylbenzothiadiazole] (PQCDTB) |
| Octyloxydithienylbenzothiadiazole (DTB) |
| Polystyrene |
| PCZDTB |

Note: PCZDTB is a polymer composed of QC derivatives, but its chemical structure is not specified in the given paragraph. Therefore, it is listed as a separate material entity.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Benzo[1,2-b:3,4-b′:5,6-d′]trithiophene (BTT) |
| Quinacridone (QC) |
| Poly[quinacridone-alt-octyloxydithienylbenzothiadiazole] (PQCDTB) |

Note: The following entities were removed as they do not clearly refer to material names:

* "polymer"
* "OTFTs"
* "donor-acceptor type (D-A type) polymer"
* "polydispersity indices (PDIs)"
* "degree of polymerization"
* "backbone structure"
* "solubility"
* "polymerization"
* "optoelectronic devices"
* "OPVs"
* "thermal stability"
* "DSC analysis"
* "X-ray diffraction measurements"

Paragraph: 16 In the McCulloch group , in addition , a hole mobility of 0.24 cm^2 V -1 S^-1 and a PCE of 2.2% were reported in a polymer containing benzo[1,2-b:3,4-b′:5,6-d′]trithiophene ( BTT ) to produce effective intermolecular packing characteristics. 17,18 Quinacridone ( QC ) derivative , which is known as a red - violet pigment , has a high crystallinity and self - assembled characteristics , so it has drawn significant attention as an OTFT because of its high mobility. 19,20 However , these QC results were primarily reported for small molecules or oligomers. In the case of polymers , extremely limited results have been reported. 21,22 In the Takimiya group , recently , a polymer composed of QC derivatives has been reported for use in OTFTs that has a high hole mobility ( 0.2 cm^2 V -1 S^-1 ). 23 In this study , we synthesized a new donor - acceptor type ( D- A type ) polymer , poly[quinacridone-alt-octyloxydithienylbenzothiadiazole] ( PQCDTB ) , which contained QC and octyloxydithienylbenzothiadiazole ( DTB ). As a result , it is most likely that a broad absorbance could be obtained as the results of the effective charge transport and the strong electron - withdrawing caused by the high coplanarity . Table 1 shows the result of the molecular weight and the thermal properties of the obtained PQCDTB. As shown in this table , when the GPC was measured using polystyrene as the standard , the number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB were 49.8 and 15.2 kg / mol , respectively. In contrast , the polydispersity indices ( PDIs ) showed a very narrow distribution of 1.92 and 1.77 , respectively. In terms of the degree of polymerization , PQCDTB was greater than other OPV polymers by 2-3 times because of the introduction of long , branched side chains of quinacridone and benzothiadiazole. As a result , the backbone structure became relatively favorable in terms of the solubility at polymerization ; polymerization had effectively occurred. 6 Table 1 showed the result of the thermal analysis through TGA. As shown in Table 1 , PQCDTB and PCZDTB had a 5% weight loss at the temperatures of 323 and 324 °C , respectively , displaying a high thermal stability because of the rigid QC and carbazole structure , which is applicable for optoelectronic devices and OPVs , both of which require a high thermal stability ( 300 °C or above ). 24 We investigated thermal behavior through DSC analysis ( see Supporting Information ) , which revealed no obvious thermal transitions for PQCDTB in the temperature range from 40 to 250 ° C. Thus , PQCDTB displayed amorphous property. Figure 1 showed X-ray diffraction measurements of film to analyze the ordering structure of the obtained polymers.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| hole mobility |
| PCE |
| crystallinity |
| self-assembled characteristics |
| high mobility |
| broad absorbance |
| effective charge transport |
| strong electron-withdrawing |

| amorphous property |

Note: Some of the properties mentioned in the paragraph, such as "high crystallinity" and "strong electron-withdrawing," are not explicitly listed as property names in the table, but they are still relevant properties of the materials being discussed.

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 16 In the McCulloch group , in addition , a hole mobility of 0.24 cm^2 V -1 S^-1 and a PCE of 2.2% were reported in a polymer containing benzo[1,2-b:3,4-b′:5,6-d′]trithiophene ( BTT ) to produce effective intermolecular packing characteristics. 17,18 Quinacridone ( QC ) derivative , which is known as a red - violet pigment , has a high crystallinity and self - assembled characteristics , so it has drawn significant attention as an OTFT because of its high mobility. 19,20 However , these QC results were primarily reported for small molecules or oligomers. In the case of polymers , extremely limited results have been reported. 21,22 In the Takimiya group , recently , a polymer composed of QC derivatives has been reported for use in OTFTs that has a high hole mobility ( 0.2 cm^2 V -1 S^-1 ). 23 In this study , we synthesized a new donor - acceptor type ( D- A type ) polymer , poly[quinacridone-alt-octyloxydithienylbenzothiadiazole] ( PQCDTB ) , which contained QC and octyloxydithienylbenzothiadiazole ( DTB ). As a result , it is most likely that a broad absorbance could be obtained as the results of the effective charge transport and the strong electron - withdrawing caused by the high coplanarity . Table 1 shows the result of the molecular weight and the thermal properties of the obtained PQCDTB. As shown in this table , when the GPC was measured using polystyrene as the standard , the number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB were 49.8 and 15.2 kg / mol , respectively. In contrast , the polydispersity indices ( PDIs ) showed a very narrow distribution of 1.92 and 1.77 , respectively. In terms of the degree of polymerization , PQCDTB was greater than other OPV polymers by 2-3 times because of the introduction of long , branched side chains of quinacridone and benzothiadiazole. As a result , the backbone structure became relatively favorable in terms of the solubility at polymerization ; polymerization had effectively occurred. 6 Table 1 showed the result of the thermal analysis through TGA. As shown in Table 1 , PQCDTB and PCZDTB had a 5% weight loss at the temperatures of 323 and 324 °C , respectively , displaying a high thermal stability because of the rigid QC and carbazole structure , which is applicable for optoelectronic devices and OPVs , both of which require a high thermal stability ( 300 °C or above ). 24 We investigated thermal behavior through DSC analysis ( see Supporting Information ) , which revealed no obvious thermal transitions for PQCDTB in the temperature range from 40 to 250 ° C. Thus , PQCDTB displayed amorphous property. Figure 1 showed X-ray diffraction measurements of film to analyze the ordering structure of the obtained polymers.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 0.24 cm^2 V^-1 S^-1 | Hole mobility of polymer containing benzo[1,2-b:3,4-b′:5,6-d′]trithiophene (BTT) |
| 2.2% | PCE (polymer containing benzo[1,2-b:3,4-b′:5,6-d′]trithiophene) |
| 0.2 cm^2 V^-1 S^-1 | Hole mobility of polymer composed of QC derivatives (Takimiya group) |
| 49.8 kg/mol | Number-average molecular weight of PQCDTB |
| 15.2 kg/mol | Number-average molecular weight of PCZDTB |
| 1.92 | Polydispersity index (PDI) of PQCDTB |
| 1.77 | Polydispersity index (PDI) of PCZDTB |
| 323°C | Temperature of 5% weight loss for PQCDTB (TGA) |
| 324°C | Temperature of 5% weight loss for PCZDTB (TGA) |
| 40-250°C | Temperature range for DSC analysis (no obvious thermal transitions for PQCDTB) |

Note: The units for the molecular weights are kg/mol, and the units for the temperature are °C.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 0.24 cm^2 V^-1 S^-1 | Hole mobility of polymer containing benzo[1,2-b:3,4-b′:5,6-d′]trithiophene (BTT) |
| 2.2% | PCE (polymer containing benzo[1,2-b:3,4-b′:5,6-d′]trithiophene) |
| 0.2 cm^2 V^-1 S^-1 | Hole mobility of polymer composed of QC derivatives (Takimiya group) |

Note: The units for the hole mobility are cm^2 V^-1 S^-1, and the units for the PCE are % (percentage).
